definition: to dress or decorate especially in splendid or impressive attire : adorn
examples: … he had already arrayed himself in his best clothes.

definition: to set or place in order : draw up, marshal
to set or set forth in order (something, such as a jury) for the trial of a cause
to arrange or display in or as if in an array
examples: The … data are arrayed in descending order.

definition: an imposing group : large number, variety, assortment
examples: faced a whole array of problems

definition: a regular and imposing grouping or arrangement : order
an orderly listing of jurors impaneled

examples: the baron and his feudal array

definition: a number of mathematical elements arranged in rows and columns, a data structure in which similar elements of data are arranged in a table
a series of statistical data arranged in classes in order of magnitude
a group of elements forming a complete unit
